And the same text says, [315] Subhūti, suppose that all the sentient beings that exist in three-million-fold world-realms as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River were to attain highest genuine full Awakening, and after attaining highest genuine full Awakening, were to be absorbed in the four dhyānas, while having conceptions about objects, for aeons as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River. And suppose that a bodhisattva great being, upholding this perfection of wisdom and skillful means, were to consider together the mass of all the moral discipline, stable attention, wisdom, liberation, and knowledge, and vision of liberation of the past, future, and present Buddhas, the Blessed Ones; and also the mass of all the moral discipline, stable attention, wisdom, liberation, and knowledge and vision of liberation of the Disciples and Solitary Sages; and rolling them all, as one, into a ball, were to ponder them, and without exception, were to rejoice in them with the highest rejoicing, with the preeminent, the best, the excellent, the most excellent, the superior, the supreme, the unexcelled, the best of the best, the incomparable, the peerless, the matchless rejoicing; and after doing so, would dedicate the goodness-forming action associated with that rejoicing to highest genuine full Awakening. Subhūti, compared to the goodness-forming action associated with that rejoicing, the performance of goodness consisting of the four dhyānas by the bodhisattvas who conceive of objects doesn’t even add up to a hundredth part, and so on up to: will not even bear comparison. This very method is also said to be for the purpose of dedication.[xxviii] Alternately, because of dedicating all goodness to Buddhahood with the highest form of dedication, your vow would be honored and Buddhahood itself would result. Then what is “enhancing goodness,” as mentioned above? Indeed, it is equipped with the goodness and pristine awareness that accomplish the freedom of sentient beings without exception; and it is nonconceptual. The advantages of requesting the Buddhas to teach are stated in the noble Inquiry of Ugra: “So as to grasp the Dharma, in order to protect your life in innumerable, uncountable Buddha-fields.”[4]
bslab pa kun las btus pa las phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa'i phan yon gyi le'u ste bcu bdun pa'o/ /

d.crumb: 18. dkon mchog gsum rjes su dran pa

f.d: [dkon mchog gsum rjes su dran pa]
18. Recollection of the Three Jewels
bzang po spyod pa la sogs pa'i tshul gyis bsod nams 'phel bar bshad zin to// //
[316] ENHANCING GOODNESS THROUGH the ritual of Good Conduct has been explained.
'di yang 'di'i rgyu gzhan yin te/
The following is another way of [enhancing goodness]:
dad pa la sogs pa rtag tu bsgom pa gang yin pa'o/ /
[25c] Constantly practicing faith and so on.

de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsang ba'i mdo las ji skad gsungs pa lta bu ste/ rgyal po chen po chos bzhi po 'di dag ni theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams yongs su mi nyams shing khyad par du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'o/ / bzhi gang zhe na/ rgyal po chen po dad pa ni yongs su mi nyams shing khyad par du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'o/ / dad pa gang zhe na/ dad pa gang gis 'phags pa'i drung du nye bar 'gro ba dang mi bya ba mi byed pa'o/ / rgyal po chen po gus pa ni khyad par du 'gro bar 'gyur ba ste/ gus pa gang gis 'phags pa rnams kyis legs par bshad pa rnams gus par nyan pa dang rna blags te chos nyan pa'o/ / rgyal po chen po nga rgyal med pa ni khyad par du 'gro bar 'gyur ba ste/ nga rgyal med pa gang gis 'phags pa rnams la mngon par 'dud pa dang rab tu 'dud pa la phyag 'tshal ba'o/ / rgyal po chen po brtson 'grus ni khyad par du 'gro bar 'gyur ba ste/ brtson 'grus gang gis lus yang ba dang sems yang ba 'thob pa dang bya ba thams cad kyang nyams 'og tu chud par byed pa ste/ rgyal po chen po chos bzhi po 'di dag ni theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams yongs su mi nyams shing khyad par du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba ste/ dad pa la sogs pa 'di dag la rtag tu goms par bya'o/ /

As the Mysteries of the Tathāgata Sūtra says, Your Majesty, for those practicing the Great Way, these four qualities lead to excellence and nonabandonment. What are the four? Your Majesty, faith leads to excellence and nonabandonment. Here, what is faith? That faith by which you come into the presence of the Noble Ones, and do not do what you should not. Your Majesty, respect leads to excellence: that respect by which you listen to what is well spoken, want to listen, and get the chance to listen to the Dharma. Your Majesty, humility leads to excellence: that humility by which you bow to the Noble Ones, prostrate to them and reverentially salute them. Your Majesty, perseverance leads to excellence and nonabandonment: that perseverance by which you attain lightness of body[i] and complete all tasks. Your Majesty, these are the four.[ii]

yang na dad pa la sogs pa gzhan dag la ste/ 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo las ji skad du/ btsun pa sha ra dwa ti'i bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang po lnga rnams mi zad pa ste/ de la dbang po lnga gang zhe na/ gang 'di dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po'o/ / de la dad pa'i dbang po gang zhe na/ dad pa gang gis chos bzhi la dad pa ste/ bzhi gang zhe na/ 'di lta ste/ 'khor ba na spyod pa'i 'jig rten pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba la dad pa ste/ de las kyi rnam par smin pa la ston pa yin/ dge ba'am sdig pa'i las gang dang gang byas pa de dang de'i rnam par smin pa myong bar 'gyur ro snyam ste srog gi phyir yang sdig pa'i las mi byed pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la dad pa ste/ spyod pa de la zhugs nas kyang theg pa gzhan la 'dod pa mi bskyed pa dang / chos thams cad la don dam pa nges pa'i don zab mo/ rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba bdag med pa sems can med pa srog med pa gso ba med pa gang zag med par rnam par dpyod pa dang / stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang smon pa med pa'i mtshan nyid du dad pa ste/ lta bar gyur pa thams cad bag la nyal bar mi byed pa dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la dad pa ste/ dad pa'i phyir the tshom dang nem nur dang bral bas sangs rgyas kyi chos de dag yang dag par sgrub pa ste 'di ni dad pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o/ /

You should constantly practice faith and so on. Alternately, [you should practice] another list beginning with faith. As the noble Akṣayamati Sūtra says, [317] There are five faculties.[iii] Here, what are the five faculties? The faculty of faith, the faculty of perseverance, the faculty of mindfulness, the faculty of stable attention, the faculty of wisdom. Here, what is faith? That faith by which people trust in four teachings. What are the four? They trust in the worldly right view that has cyclic existence as its scope. They rely on the evolution of actions: “Whatever action I do, I will experience the result of evolution of that very action.” Even if their lives are at risk, they don’t act wrongly. They trust in the bodhisattva way of life. Following that way of life, they do not yearn for another way. They hear, and trust, the ultimate truth, the definitive meaning, which is that everything has the characteristics of profound dependent arising, no self, no sentient being, no life-force, no person, conventionality, emptiness, no characteristics, and no aspirations. They do not adhere to any false views. They trust in all the qualities of a Buddha: the powers, the fearlessnesses, and so on. Because of faith, they have no doubts, and they develop those qualities of a Buddha. This is called the faculty of faith.

de la brtson 'grus kyi dbang po gang zhe na/ chos gang la dad pa'i dbang pos dad par 'gyur ba'i chos de dag brtson 'grus kyi dbang pos yang dag par sgrub pa ste/ 'di ni brtson 'grus kyi dbang po zhes bya'o/ / de la dran pa'i dbang po gang zhe na/ chos gang brtson 'grus kyi dbang pos yang dag par bsgrub pa'i chos de dag dran pa'i dbang pos chud mi gson te/ 'di ni dran pa'i dbang po zhes bya'o/ / de la ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po gang zhe na/ dran pa'i dbang pos chos gang chud mi gson pa'i chos de dag ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang pos rtse gcig tu byed de/ 'di ni ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po zhes bya'o/ / de la shes rab kyi dbang po gang zhe na/ chos gang ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang pos rtse gcig tu byas pa'i chos de dag shes rab kyi dbang pos rab tu rtog cing shin tu rtog par byed de/ gang chos de dang de dag la gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog par shes shing so sor rang gis shes pa 'di ni shes rab kyi dbang po zhes bya'o/ / de ltar na dbang po lnga po 'di dag ni lhan cig tu 'grogs shing rjes su 'brel pa ste/ sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rdzogs par byed do/ / lung bstan pa'i sar yang gzhog go zhes gsungs pa bzhin no/ /

Here, what is the faculty of perseverance? Those qualities that the faculty of faith trusts, the faculty of perseverance develops. This is called the faculty of perseverance. Here, what is the faculty of mindfulness? Those qualities that the faculty of perseverance develops, the faculty of mindfulness does not allow to go to waste. This is called the faculty of mindfulness. Here, what is the faculty of stable attention? Those qualities that the faculty of mindfulness does not allow to go to waste are made one-pointed by the faculty of stable attention. This is called the faculty of stable attention. Here, what is the faculty of wisdom? Those qualities that are made one-pointed by the faculty of stable attention, those qualities the faculty of wisdom reflects on and understands. Knowing those qualities for yourself, in a way not dependent on anyone else, is called the faculty of wisdom. In this way these faculties mutually cooperate and are linked; they bring to completion all the qualities of a Buddha, and lead to the stage where a prophecy of Awakening will be made.

dad pa la sogs pa'i stobs rnams la yang rtag tu goms par bya ste/ 'phags pa gtsug na rin po che'i mdo las ji skad du/ rigs kyi bu de la byang chub sems dpa'i stobs kyi spyod pa yongs su dag pa gang zhe na/ gang dbang po de dag gis nye bar bstan nas bdud thams cad kyis mi brdzi bar 'gyur ba dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa gnyis kyis mi 'phrogs par 'gyur ba dang / theg pa chen po 'di las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba dang / nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis mi thul bar 'gyur ba dang / sngon gyi dam bcas pa la brtan par 'gyur ba dang / sems kyi stobs shin tu brtan par 'gyur ba dang / lus kyi stobs dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / dbang po rnams sbed par 'gyur ba dang / dgra rnams kyis mi tshugs par 'gyur ba dang / phyir rgol ba thams cad kyis mi bskyod par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa bzhin no/ / de ltar/ /

You should constantly practice faith and the other powers. As the noble Sūtra on the Jewel at the Crown of the Head says, Here, noble sir, what is the purity of a bodhisattva’s power and way of life? That, supported by these very faculties, you cannot be trampled on by all the Māras; that you cannot be pulled back by the ways of Disciples and Solitary Sages; that you become irreversible due to the Great Way; that you become difficult for all reactive emotions to overpower; that you become firm in your previous commitments; that you are not satisfied;[iv] that you are strong of body; that you are protected by the faculties;[v] that you become difficult for non-Buddhists to defeat …[vi]
re zhig bsod nams spel ba'i phyir/ / dad pa la sogs rtag tu bsgom/ / gzhan yang
Thus, the constant practice of faith and so on enhances goodness. What is
byams dang
[25d] lovingkindness
zhes bya ba ni/

zla ba'i sgron ma'i mdo las ji skad du/ / bye ba khrag khrig dkrigs pa'i zhing dag na/ / mchod pa rnam mang dpag med ji snyed pa/ / skyes mchog rnams la de yis rtag mchod pas/ / byams pa'i sems kyi grangs dang char mi phod/ / ces gsungs pa lta bu'o/ / gzhan yang

[318] As the Candrapradīpa Sūtra says, Innumerable offerings of many kinds, As many as there are in a hundred billion trillion fields,[vii] When always offered to the best among humans— They all don’t add up to as much as a thought of lovingkindness. What is
sangs rgyas sogs dran bya/ /
[25d] recollection of the Buddhas, and the rest
sangs rgyas la sogs pa rjes su dran pa de yang gang zhe na/

'phags pa yul 'khor skyong gis zhus pa'i mdo las bsngags pa ste/ mtshan mchog ldan pa dri med zla ba'i zhal/ / gser mdog 'dra ba khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ / rdul bral khyod 'dra srid pa gsum ma mchis/ / mnyam med mkhyen can khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ /

On this topic, the Rāṣṭrapāla Sūtra offers praise:[1] I revere you, with a color like gold, With the supreme marks, with a face like a flawless moon. I revere you, who are wholly engaged in peerless pristine awareness; Dustless one, you have no equal in the threefold world.
rgyal ba'i dbu skra 'jam mdzes snum zhing bzang / / khyod kyi gtsug tor 'di na ri rgyal bzhin/ / gtsug tor mi mthong khyod dang mtshungs ma mchis/ / thub pa khyod kyi smin mtshams mdzod spus mdzes/ /
kun da zla ba kha ba dung ltar dkar/ / thugs rje gang gis 'gro ba 'di gzigs pa/ / spyan mchog bzang po ut+pal sngon po 'dra/ / rgyal ba dri med spyan la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Those best of eyes with which you look benevolently upon the world Are as white as jasmine, the moon, a conch shell, or snow, And as beautiful as a blue lotus. Victor, I revere your flawless eyes.
ljags yangs srab la zangs kyi mdog 'dra ba/ / de yis rang gi zhal gyi gdong yang khebs/ / chos gsungs pas ni 'gro ba 'dul bar bgyi/ / 'jam snum gsung ldan khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Your tongue is long and slender,[viii] the color of copper, And with it you can cover your own face. By speaking the Dharma, you discipline the world; I revere you, of honeyed and unctuous speech.
tshems bzang shin tu brtan pa rdo rje 'dra/ / bcu dang sum cu snyoms shing thags bzang ba/ / 'dzum pa mdzad nas 'gro ba 'dul bar bgyid/ / bden gtam snyan pa khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Your beautiful teeth are very hard, like diamonds, Thirty and ten, even, and with no gaps. By smiling, you discipline the world; I revere you, of honeyed, truthful speech.
rgyal ba khyod kyi gzugs dang mtshungs ma mchis/ / 'od kyis zhing brgya dag kyang snang bar bgyid/ / 'jig rten na ni tshangs dbang skyong de dag / bcom ldan khyod kyi 'od kyis zil du brlag /
Victor, your form has no equal; With your radiance, you illuminate a hundred fields. Blessed One, the Brahmās, Indras, and Protectors of the world [319] Are outshined by your radiance.
e na'i byin pa mnyam med bcom ldan 'das/ / glang po'i rgyal po rma bya seng ge'i stabs/ / bcom ldan gnya' shing gang du gzigs shing gshegs/ / sa dang ri dang ngam pa g.yo bar mdzad/ /

Blessed One, your calves are unequalled, like those of the black antelope; You walk like a king of elephants, a peacock, or [a lion,] the king of beasts. Blessed One, you walk looking ahead only a plow’s length, Shaking the earth, mountains, and slopes.
bcom ldan 'das sku mtshan gyis brgyan pa ste/ / khyod kyi pags pa 'jam zhing gser mdog 'dra/ / 'gro ba gzugs 'di lta bas ngoms mi 'gyur/ / khyod ni mtshungs pa ma mchis gzugs dang ldan/ /
Blessed One, your body is full of marks, With an exquisite skin color like the color of gold. People just can’t get enough of seeing your beauty, You who are incomparably beautiful.
khyod sngon bskal pa brgyar ni dka' thub spyad/ / khyod gtong dul dang sbyin pa kun la dgyes/ / sems can kun la thugs rje byams thugs ldan/ / mchog tu thugs rje can la phyag 'tshal lo/ /

For hundreds of past aeons, you performed austerities, Tamed by renouncing everything and delighting in giving. I revere you who are benevolent to all sentient beings, With a mind of lovingkindness, compassionate to the highest degree.
khyod ni sbyin dang tshul khrims rtag tu dgyes/ / khyod ni bzod dang brtson 'grus dges rab brtan/ / khyod ni bsam gtan shes rab 'od gzigs mnga'/ / mtshungs med ye shes mnga' la phyag 'tshal lo/ /

You are always dedicated to generosity and moral discipline; You are very firmly dedicated to patient endurance and perseverance. You have the radiance of meditative stability and wisdom. I revere you, bearer of energy, bearer of matchless pristine awareness.
khyod ni smra ba ngan pa'i tshogs can 'joms/ / khyod ni seng ge lta bur 'khor du sgrogs/ / khyod ni sman pa'i rgyal po dri gsum sel/ / mchog tu dga' mdzad khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
Hero of doctrine, you defeat inferior religious leaders. You roar like a lion in the assembly. King of physicians, you put an end to three forms of impurity; I revere you, supreme bringer of delight.
thub pa sku gsung thugs ni rnam par dag / pad ma chu ltar srid pa gsum mi gos/ / khyod ni tshangs dbyangs ka la ping ka'i skad/ / srid gsum pha rol gshegs la phyag 'tshal lo/ /
khyod kyis 'gro 'di sgyu ma lta bu dang / / gar la lta dang rmi lam 'dra ba dang / / bdag med sems can med cing srog 'gro med/ / chos rnams smig rgyu chu zla 'dra bar mkhyen/ /
You, sir, know that this world is like an illusion, A theatrical stage, or a dream, With no self, no sentient being, and no life force. Everything is like a mirage or the moon in water.
stong pa zhi ba skye ba med pa'i tshul/ / ma shes pas na 'gro ba 'khyams 'gyur te/ / thugs rje thabs tshul rig pa brgya dag gis/ / de dag rnams ni 'dzud par mdzad pa lags/ /
Not knowing the way things are—empty, peaceful, and nonarising— The world wanders around. Out of deep compassion for them, [320] You enter into hundreds of expedient methods, forms of skillful means.
'dod chags la sogs nad mang brgya dag gis/ / skrag par 'gyur ba'i 'gro la rtag gzigs te/ / bde gshegs sems can brgya dag yongs 'grel cing / / zla med dman pa lta bu rnam par rgyu/ /

Continually seeing that the world is terrified By hundreds of great diseases such as attraction and so on, Well-Gone One, you make your rounds like an incomparable doctor, Setting free hundreds of sentient beings.
skye dang rga dang 'chi dang mya ngan non/ / sdug dang bral dang smre sngags 'don pa brgyas/ / rtag tu na ba'i 'gro ba gzigs nas ni/ / thub pa thugs rjes yongs su 'grel zhing rgyu/ /

Sage, after surveying the world, which is always afflicted, Struck down by birth, old age, death, and sorrow, By separation from loved ones and by hundreds of forms of lamentation, You make your rounds out of compassion, setting beings free.
dud 'gro yi dwags dmyal ba'i 'gro rnams su/ / 'gro kun shing rta'i 'phang lo bzhin du 'khor/ / glen pa dmigs bu ma mchis mgon ma mchis/ / de la lam gyi dam pa ston mdzad pa/

The whole world wanders like the wheel of a chariot, Among the animals, the hungry ghosts, in the hell-realms, and in the good rebirths, Confused, with no guide, with no guardian. To it, you show the best of paths.
gtso bo mtshungs pa med pas gang bstan pa/ / 'phags lam de nyid gang dag sngon chad kyi/ / chos kyi dbang phyug 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa/ / rgyal ba de dag rnams kyis rab tu gsungs/ /
Those who in ancient times Were the Victors, the lords of Dharma, and bringers of benefit to the world, They declared the exact same noble path That you teach, eminent and incomparable one.
'jam zhing mnyen la yid du 'ong ba'i mchog / tshangs las lhag par mchog tu dga' bgyid pa/ / dri za mi ci lha yi bu mo mchog / sgra de zil gyis mnan nas gsung pa mdzad/ /
Your voice is smooth, gentle, enchanting, the very best, Superior to that of Brahmā, supremely delightful, Surpassing even the voices of Celestial musicians, half-humans, and the best of nymphs.
bden dang drang ba mi zad thabs tshul gyis/ / yongs sbyangs yon tan mtha' yas ldan pa'i gsung / / de thos sems can khrag khrig phrag brgya dag / theg pa gsum gyis zhi bar mchi bar bgyid/ /

Your voice has endless advantages, made pure Through unbreakable honesty and sincerity and the methods of skillful means. When they hear it, hundreds of millions[ix] of sentient beings Find peace through the three Ways.
khyod la mchod pas lha yi bde ba ni/ / rnam pa mang dang de bzhin mi yis 'thob/ / mi yi bdag po 'gro la phan bgyid pa/ / phyug cing nor che 'byor pa chen por 'gyur/ /
By making offerings to you in this way, people obtain Divine happiness of many kinds. They become wealthy, very rich, very powerful, Rulers who achieve the welfare of the world.
mtshungs med khyod la dad pa bskyed pa ni/ / gling bzhi bdag po 'khor los sgyur ba mchog / 'gro la dge ba bcu po kun 'byed pa/ / rin chen rab bzang bdun ldan thob par 'gyur/ /

They even become mighty world-emperors, lords of bipeds, Covering the world with the ten wholesome courses of action. Those who trust in you, who are incomparable, [321] Obtain the very beautiful seven treasures.[2]
rgyal ba khyod la mchod pa bgyis pas ni/ / tshangs pa brgya byin 'jig rten bdag po dang / / yongs su dga' ldan lha yi bdag po dang / / gzhan 'phrul ba dang 'thab bral rab dgar 'gyur/ /

They also become Brahmās, Śakras, world-protectors, And very happy kings of gods. By making offerings to you, they become Gods controlling others’ emanations, kings of the Yāma gods, and also Victors.
'gro ba'i sdug bsngal rnam mang sel mdzad pa/ / mnyam med khyod la mchod dang mthong ba dang / / thos pa'ang de ltar 'bras bu mchis lags te/ / gnas mchog rga shi med pa 'thob par 'gyur/ /
In this way, those who make offerings to you who are unequalled, Or even see or hear you, will unfailingly Remove the various forms of suffering of the world And touch the highest, dustless path.
bcom ldan lam la mkhas shing lam mkhyen pa/ / 'jig rten 'di ni ngan pa'i lam las zlog / bcom ldan 'gro ba dag ni 'phags pa'i lam/ / bde ba zhi ba rdul dang bral la 'god/ /
Blessed One, knowing the path, skilled in the path, You turn the world away from bad paths, And establish the world in the noble path, Which is peaceful, fortunate, and dustless, Blessed One.
bsod nams gter khyod bsod nams don gnyer ba'i/ / bsod nams bgyi ba rtag tu mi bas te/ / byang chub dam pa ma thob bar du ni/ / bskal pa bye ba mang por bas mi 'gyur/ /

For those who seek goodness, an act of goodness towards you Becomes an eternally indestructible treasure-house of goodness. Even in many tens of millions of aeons, it is not exhausted Until they reach the highest Awakening.
gzhan 'phrul 'dra ba rtag tu dga' bgyid pa/ / yongs su dag cing mdzes pa thob par 'gyur/ / dam pa'i zhing du lus dang ngag yid kyis/ / sems can dag ni rnam par dag par 'gyur/ /

They attain a radiant pure field, always delightful, Shining like the heaven of the gods who control others’ emanations.[3] And in this best of fields, sentient beings Are also pure in thought, word, and deed.
rgyal ba mchod pa'i mi yis 'di la sogs/ / yon tan rnam pa du ma thob par 'gyur/ / mtho ris thar pa mi yi bde ba dang / / 'gro ba kun gyi bsod nams gter thob 'gyur/ /

Thus, people who have worshipped the Victors Obtain various abilities, including these and others. They attain heaven and final liberation, happiness among humans, And a storehouse of goodness for the whole world.
khyod kyi brjod dang grags pa rgya chen po/ / phyogs rnams kun gyi zhing mang brgyar yang mchis/ / rgyal ba khyod kyi bsngags pa'i phreng ba ni/ / bde bar gshegs rnams 'khor du rtag par sgrogs/ /
Your fame and reputation have spread widely, In all directions, to many hundreds of fields. The Well-Gone Ones continually Sing your praises in assemblies.
rims nad bral zhing 'gro ba thar mdzad pa/ / mthong na dga' ba thugs rje mchog ldan pa/ / bcom ldan dbang po zhi ba zhi dges pa/ / mi mchog dam pa khyod la phyag 'tshal lo/ /

Having recovered from fever, you are a liberator of living beings, Delightful to look at, of unequalled compassion. With peaceful faculties, finding bliss in peace, [322] I revere you, Blessed One, most excellent of men.
bdag gis rgyal ba khyod kyi gsung thos nas/ / mngon par shes pa lnga thob mkha' la gnas/ / dpa' bo bde gshegs mtshungs par bdag gyur te/ / dri med chos ni 'gro la rnam par dbye/ /

Now that I have heard your voice, Victor, I have attained the five superknowledges; I am resting in the sky. Hero, I will become like the Well-Gone One, And I will share the stainless Dharma with the world.

lha dang mi dang klus mchod bde bar gshegs/ / yon tan kun gyi mthar phyin deng bstod pas/ / bsod nams rgya chen gang bsgrubs gyur pa 'dis/ / 'gro ba sangs rgyas go 'phang thob par shog/ / ces bya'o/ /

Through the vast goodness I have attained today By praising the Well-Gone One, who has mastered all abilities, Who is honored by humans, gods, and serpent-spirits, May the world also attain the Buddha’s path.

yang na chos yang dag par sdud pa'i mdo las gsungs pa ste/ gzhan yang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po mnga' ba/ byams pa chen po dang snying rje chen po'i spyod yul can/ / sems can gyi phung po chen po'i skyabs su gyur pa/ mgon du gyur pa/ sman pa chen po zug rngu 'byin pa/ sems can thams cad la sems snyoms pa/ rtag tu ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul pa/ 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa las rnam par grol ba nas/ sems can thams cad kyi pha ma lta bur gyur pa dgra zin la sems snyoms pa'i bar du'o/ / de bzhin du sbyar te/ 'jig rten thams cad zil gyis gnon pa/ 'jig rten thams cad kyi snang bar gyur pa/ rnal 'byor chen po la rnal 'byor pa/ bsam gtan chen po'i spyod yul ba/ rnam par grol ba phun sum tshogs pa/ bdag nyid chen po/ / skye bo chen po'i zham 'bring ba dang ldan pa/ skye bo khyad par can gyi zham 'bring ba dang ldan pa/ lta ba dang nyan pa dang brten pa dang bsnyen bkur byed pa mi zlogs pa/ bdag bde ba la mi lta ba/ gzhan gyi sdug bsngal zhi bar byed pa la dgyes pa/ chos la gzhol ba/ chos kyi nor can/ chos kyi zas can/ chos kyi sman can/ chos kyi gter chen/ chos kyi dbang phyug / chos kyi bdag po/ chos kyi sbyin bdag / rtag tu gtong ba la mngon par dgyes pa/ rtag tu bag yod pa/ rtag tu dben pa la mngon par dgyes pa/ thams cad du stegs dang zam par gyur pa/ rgyal po'i lam chen po dang 'dra ba/ nyi ma chen po dang 'dra ba/ tshangs pa chen po dang 'dra ba/ ye shes chen po'i rdo rje 'chang ba/ chos chen pos dbugs 'byin pa/ gzugs lta bas mi ngoms pa mthong bas mi ngoms pa ste/ sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag de ltar rjes su dran no/ / de dag de ltar rjes su dran pas de dag gi yon tan yongs su sgrub pa'i phyir sbyor ro/ / dran pa nye bar 'jog go/ / brtson 'grus rtsom mo/ / de'i phyir sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa zhes bya ste/ 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o/ /

Alternately, the noble Sūtra on Chanting the Dharma Together says: Moreover, the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, who have the great equipment of goodness and pristine awareness, whose domain is great lovingkindness and great compassion, who have become the rescuers of the great multitude of sentient beings,[x] the great physicians who remove the arrow,[4] impartial towards all sentient beings, always having stable attention as their domain, freed from both cyclic existence and Nirvāṇa … able to be mothers and fathers to all sentient beings, with minds of equal lovingkindness[xi] … outshining the whole world, the lights of the whole world, the greatest among spiritual practitioners,[xii] great ones, with the multitude as their retinue, with distinguished people among their retinue, with nothing to stop people from seeing them, hearing them, or paying respects to them, with no regard to their own happiness, fond of relieving the suffering of others, fond of Dharma, bearers of Dharma, living on Dharma, physicians of Dharma,[xiii] lords of Dharma, masters of Dharma, givers of Dharma, always delighting in renunciation, always free from heedlessness, always delighting in solitude, having become fords and bridges to everywhere, like the royal road …[xiv] People can’t get enough of looking at them, the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones. This is how you recollect them. And after recollecting them in this way, in order to develop their abilities fully, you apply mindfulness.[xv] This is called the “recollection of the Buddhas.”[xvi]

'di nyid las chos rjes su dran pa gsungs pa/ 'di la byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te/ gang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag ni yon tan mtha' yas mu med pa ste/ de dag ni chos las skyes pa/ chos kyi bgo skal la spyod pa/ chos kyis sprul pa/ chos bdag por gyur pa/ chos las byung ba/ chos kyi spyod yul/ chos la brten pa/ chos kyis grub pa ste/ gang sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po de dag kyang / chos las skyes pa/ chos las rnyed pa chos kyis grub pa'o/ / gang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi/ de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang mi 'jigs pa bzhi po de dag kyang chos las skyes pa chos las rnyed pa chos kyis grub pa'o/ / gang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad po de dag kyang chos las skyes pa chos las rnyed pa chos kyis grub pa'o/ / gang 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bde ba'i yo byad de dag kyang chos las skyes pa chos las rnyed pa chos kyis grub pa'o/ / de bas na bdag sangs rgyas kyi byang chub tshol bas chos gtso bor bya'o/ / chos spyod yul ba dang / chos la brten pa dang / chos la gzhol ba dang / chos snying por byed pa dang / chos rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrub par bya'o snyam pa 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'i chos rjes su dran pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o/ /

In the same text, the recollection of Dharma is described: [323] Here a bodhisattva thinks the following: “The Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, of endless, limitless abilities, are born from Dharma, have Dharma as their path, are produced by Dharma, are ruled by Dharma, are radiant with Dharma, have Dharma as their domain, rely on Dharma, arise from Dharma …[xvii] {The auspicious major and minor marks of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, those also are born from Dharma, found from Dharma, produced by Dharma. The ten powers and four fearlessnesses of the Tathāgatas are also born from Dharma, found from Dharma, produced by Dharma. The eighteen unique qualities of the Tathāgatas are also born from Dharma, found from Dharma, produced by Dharma.} All worldly and transcendent forms of happiness that exist are also born from Dharma, arisen from Dharma,[xviii] {found from Dharma.} Therefore, as my goal is Awakening, I should have Dharma as my spiritual teacher. I should respect Dharma, rely on Dharma, focus on Dharma, practice the pith of Dharma, seek Dharma, and attain Dharma.”[xix] [324] This is called a bodhisattva’s recollection of Dharma.

gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di snyam du sems te/ chos ni sems can thams cad la mnyam par 'jug pas chos ni tha ma dang 'bring dang rab mthong nas 'jug pa ma yin te/ de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o/ / chos ni phyogs su ma lhung bas chos ni ngor lta zhing 'jug pa ma yin te/ de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o/ / chos ni dus chad pa med pa/ 'di mthong ba la don yod pa rang gi rig pas chos ni dus la lta zhing 'jug pa ma yin te/ de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o/ / chos ni mthon dman med pas chos ni rgya che ba la 'jug pa ma yin dman pa la 'jug pa ma yin te/ / de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang mthun pa'i sems su bya'o/ / chos ni mchog dang tha ma dang bral bas chos ni rnam par dag pa la yang 'jug pa ma yin nyams pa la 'jug pa yang ma yin te/ de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o/ / chos ni zhing dang zhing ma yin pa'i lta ba dang bral bas chos ni 'phags pa la 'jug pa yang ma yin so so'i skye bo la 'jug pa yang ma yin te/ de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o/ /

Moreover, the bodhisattva thinks the following: “Dharma is equal, and operates equally with respect to sentient beings. The Dharma operates without regard for inferior, middling, and superior. In the same way, I should have a mind like the Dharma. The Dharma does not operate by seeking happiness,[xx] for the Dharma is impartial. In the same way, I should have a mind like the Dharma. The Dharma operates without regard to time, for the Dharma is timeless, a come-and-see kind of thing, to be experienced for yourself. In the same way, I should have a mind like the Dharma. The Dharma does not operate in terms of lofty or lowly, for the Dharma has no higher or lower. In the same way, I should have a mind like the Dharma. The Dharma does not operate in terms of the pure and the downtrodden, for the Dharma has no glory or disgrace. In the same way, I should have a mind like the Dharma. The Dharma does not operate in terms of Noble Ones and does not operate in terms of ordinary people, for the Dharma has no views about fields.[xxi] In the same way, I should have a mind like the Dharma.

chos ni rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pas chos ni nyin mo 'jug pa ma yin mtshan mo 'jug pa ma yin/ mtshan mo 'jug la nyin mo mi 'jug pa ma yin te/ de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o/ / chos ni gang la yang nam yang sdod pa ma yin pas chos ni 'dul ba'i dus las kyang mi 'da' ste/ de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o/ / chos ni thams cad du 'dod pa med pas chos ni sdang ba rnams la zhe 'gras pa yang med dad pa rnams la rjes su chags pa yang med de/ de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o/ / chos ni bri ba yang ma yin gang ba yang ma yin te dpag tu med grangs med pas nam mkha' ltar 'bri ba yang ma yin 'phel ba yang ma yin te/ de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o/ /

It is not true that the Dharma operates by day and not by night; it is not true that the Dharma operates by night and not by day. The Dharma is always continuously engaged. In the same way, I should have a mind like the Dharma. The Dharma does not transgress the limits of the monastic code, and does not have any procrastination. In the same way, I should have a mind like the Dharma.[xxii] {The Dharma is completely free from attraction. It has no hostility towards those who are averse to it, and also no attachment towards those who have faith in it. In the same way, I also should have a mind like the Dharma.} The Dharma has no deficiency nor completeness, for the Dharma is immeasurable and incalculable. Like space, it neither diminishes nor increases. In the same way, I should have a mind like the Dharma.

chos ni sems can rnams kyis srung ba ma yin gyi chos kyis sems can rnams srung ba ste/ de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o/ / chos ni skyabs yongs su tshol ba ma yin pas chos ni 'jig rten thams cad kyi skyabs yin te/ de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o/ / chos ni thogs pa med pa'i mtshan nyid pas chos ni gang la yang thogs pa med de/ de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o/ / chos ni bag la nyal med pas bag la nyal mi 'jug ste/ de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o/ / chos ni rtag tu rnam par mi rtog pas chos ni 'khor bas 'jigs skrag pa yang ma yin mya ngan las 'das pa la rjes su chags pa yang ma yin te/ de ltar bdag gis kyang chos dang 'dra ba'i sems su bya'o snyam mo/ / de ltar na byang chub sems dpa' chos ltar dran pa nye bar 'jog pas de'i phyir chos rjes su dran pa zhes bya ste/ rigs kyi bu 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' chos rjes su dran pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa zhes bya'o zhes so/ /

The Dharma is not protected by sentient beings. The Dharma protects sentient beings. In the same way, I should have a mind like the Dharma. The Dharma does not search for a refuge. The Dharma is a refuge for the whole world. In the same way, I should have a mind like the Dharma. The Dharma is not obstructed by anything, for the Dharma has the characteristic of being unobstructed. In the same way, I should have a mind like the Dharma. The Dharma does not carry any reactive patterns, for the Dharma is free from reactive patterns. In the same way, I should have a mind like the Dharma. The Dharma is not afraid of the dangers of cyclic existence; nor is it attached to Nirvāṇa, for the Dharma is always free from mistaken thoughts. In the same way, I should have a mind like the Dharma.” In this way, a bodhisattva applies mindfulness to the Dharma in a manner that is similar to the Dharma. This is called “recollection of the Dharma.”[xxiii] {Noble sir, this bodhisattva applies mindfulness to the recollection of the Dharma.}

yang de nyid las gsungs pa/ dge 'dun ni chos smra ba/ chos spyod pa/ chos sems pa/ chos kyi zhing / chos 'dzin pa/ chos la ston pa/ chos la mchod pa/ chos kyi bya ba byed pa/ chos kyi spyod yul ba/ chos spyod pa phun sum tshogs pa/ rang bzhin gyis drang ba/ rang bzhin gyis dag pa/ snying rje'i chos can/ snying rje dang ldan pa/ rtag tu dben pa'i spyod yul ba/ rtag tu chos la gzhol ba/ rtag tu dkar po spyod pa'o snyam mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o/ /

The same text says, “For the religious community proclaims the Dharma, practices the Dharma, reflects on the Dharma, is the field of Dharma, is the bearer of Dharma, takes refuge in the Dharma, makes offerings to the Dharma, performs the duties of Dharma, has Dharma as its domain, possesses Dharma practices, and is straight by nature, pure by nature, benevolent and compassionate according to Dharma, always having solitude as its domain, always focused on Dharma, always doing bright actions.” And so on.

de la byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun rjes su dran pa ni 'di lta bu yin te/ dge 'dun gyi yon tan yang dag pa gang yin pa de dag bdag gis/ bdag dang sems can thams cad la bsgrub par bya'o snyam pa ste/ 'phags pa dri ma med par grags pas bstan pa las/ byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan ji skad du 'byung ba de lta bur dge 'dun rjes su dran pa bsgom par bya'o/ /

Here a bodhisattva, recollecting the religious community, thinks as follows: “I should make sure that I and all sentient beings attain the abilities that the community has developed.” You should meditate on the recollection of the religious community according to the statement of the abilities of bodhisattvas in the noble Holy Teaching of Vimalakīrti:[5]
sems can kun gyi gzugs dang ni/ / skad dang dbyangs su gang brjod pa/ / byang chub sems dpa' mkhas rnams kyis/ / skad cig gcig la ston par byed/ /
In a single moment, The fearless bodhisattvas display All the forms of sentient beings And all the sounds and songs they utter.
sgyu ma'i chos kyis rnam rtsen pa/ / de dag sems can smin bya'i phyir/ / rga ba dang ni na bar 'gyur/ / bdag nyid shi bar rab tu ston/ /
They show themselves as old and sick And manifest their own deaths, With their easy mastery of illusions, In order to help sentient beings to mature.
sa rnams kun du tshig par ni/ / bskal pas bsreg par kun ston te/ / sems can rtag par 'du shes pa/ / mi rtag par ni rab bstan to/ /
To beings who have a conception of permanence, They manifest impermanence, Displaying the aeonic fire That burns the earth.
sems can bye ba stong rnams kyang / / yul gcig tu ni mgron du gnyer/ / thams cad khyim du zan byin te/ / thams cad byang chub phyir bsngo'o/ /
In each country, Invited by hundreds of thousands[xxiv] of sentient beings, They accept alms at the homes of all of them And dedicate everything to Awakening.
sngags dang rig pa ci yod dang / / bzo gnas rnam pa mang po dag / thams cad kyi yang pha rol phyin/ / sems can thams cad bde thob byed/ /
In knowledge of all the mantras there are, And in many kinds of artistic techniques, They attain perfection And bring happiness to all sentient beings.
'jig rten ya mtshan ji snyed pa/ / de dag kun du rab byung nas/ / lta ba tha dad gyur pa yi/ / sems can rnams ni yongs su 'grol/ /
They accept ordination [325] In all the strange cults of the world, And so help to mature Those sentient beings who have developed various false views.
zla ba'am nyi mar de gyur te/ / brgya byin tshangs pa skye dgu'i bdag / chu dang me yang rab 'gyur te/ / sa dang rlung du'ang de bzhin no/ /
They become suns or moons, Śakras, Brahmās, or Lords of Creatures. They also become water, Fire, earth, and wind.
nad kyi bskal pa bar ma la/ / de ni rtsi mchog dam par 'gyur/ / des ni sems can rnam grol zhing / / nad rnams med cing bde bar 'gyur/ /
During the intermediate aeons of plague, The supreme ones become medicine, With which they set free sentient beings Who become happy and healthy.
mu ge'i bskal pa bar ma la/ / zas dang skom du bsgyur nas su/ / bkres shing skom pa med byas te/ / srog chags rnams la chos ston to/ /
During the intermediate aeons of famine, They become food and drink, And after relieving hunger and thirst, They teach the Dharma to living beings.
mtshon gyi bskal pa bar ma la/ / de dag byams pa bsgom 'gyur te/ / sems can bye ba brgya mang po/ / gnod sems med la 'dzud par byed/ /
During the intermediate aeons of swords, They meditate on lovingkindness, And urge many billions of sentient beings To have no malice.
g.yul chen 'dres pa'i nang du ni/ / de dag phyogs la mnyam par 'gyur/ / byang chub sems dpa' stobs chen rnams/ / 'dum zhing 'du bar dga' bar byed/ /
In the midst of great battles, They are impartial; The mighty bodhisattvas Excel in reconciliation and in bringing people together.
sangs rgyas zhing ni ji snyed pa/ / bsam gyis mi khyab dmyal bar yang / / sems can rnams la phan bya'i phyir/ / bsams bzhin du ni der 'gro'o/ /
They intentionally go into As many hells as there are In the inconceivably numerous Buddha-fields, In order to promote the welfare of sentient beings.
ji snyed dud 'gro'i skye gnas kyi/ / 'gro ba'i bar du bstan pa ni/ / thams cad du yang chos ston te/ / de'i phyir rnam par 'dren ces bya/ /
They manifest all the places of rebirth, Some in animal wombs; Everywhere, they teach the Dharma. Therefore, they are called guides.
'dod pa'i longs spyod rnams kyang ston/ / bsam gtan pa la bsam gtan ston/ / bdud rnams rab tu 'joms byed cing / / de dag glags su 'gyur mi byed/ /
They display sensual pleasures, And equally, meditative stability to meditators. They completely defeat Māra And give him no opportunity.
me dbus na ni pad ma ltar/ / byung ma myong ba de ston te/ / de bzhin 'dod dang bsam gtan yang / / byung ma myong ba de ston to/ /
Just as it could be shown that a lotus Cannot exist in the middle of a fire, In the same way, they show the unreality [326] Of both sensual pleasures and meditative stability.
bsams bzhin smad 'tshong rnams su sgyur/ / skyes pa rnams ni bsdu ba'i phyir/ / 'dod chags lcags kyus drongs nas su/ / de dag sangs rgyas ye shes 'god/ /
They intentionally become courtesans In order to attract men, And, enticing them with the hook of sexual attraction, They establish them in the pristine awareness of the Buddhas.
sems can rnams la phan pa'i phyir/ / grong mi dang ni ded dpon dang / / mdun na 'don dang blon po dang / / blon po chen por rtag tu 'gyur/ /
They always become village headmen,[xxv] Caravan-leaders, family chaplains, Government ministers, and prime ministers, In order to promote the welfare of sentient beings.
sems can dbul po rnams la ni/ / zad mi shes pa'i gter du gyur/ / gang la sbyin pa byin pa yang / / de dag byang chub sems bskyed btsud/ /
They become inexhaustible treasures For poor sentient beings, And after giving them gifts, Arouse Awakening Mind in them.
nga rgyal khengs pa'i sems can la/ / de dag tshan chen mchog gyur te/ / nga rgyal kun kyang bcom nas su/ / bla med byang chub tshol du btsud/ /
Among sentient beings made rigid by pride, They become noble champions,[xxvi] And after subduing all their pride, Lead them to aim for highest Awakening.
'jigs skrag sems can rnams la ni/ / rtag tu de yi mdun na 'dug / de dag mi 'jigs byin nas kyang / / byang chub tu ni smin par byed/ /
They always appear before Sentient beings who are oppressed by fear, And having granted them safety, Help them to mature towards Awakening.
de dag lnga mngon shes pa yi/ / drang srong tshangs par spyod gyur te/ / bzod dang des dang tshul khrims dang / / sdom pa la ni sems can 'god/ /
After gaining the five superknowledges, They become celibate seers, And urge sentient beings to moral discipline, Patient endurance, gentleness, and self-restraint.
rim gro lhur byed sems can rnams/ / 'jigs pa med pas 'dir mthong nas/ / bran dang g.yog tu shin tu 'gyur/ / slob mar yang ni nye bar 'gro/ /
When they see sentient beings doing respectful service, They fearlessly become Servants or slaves, Or agree to become students.
yan lag gang dang gang rnams kyis/ / sems can chos la dgar gyur pa/ / thabs chen shin tu bslabs pa dag / bya ba dag ni thams cad ston/ /
Whatever the way is by which a sentient being [327] Could come to delight in the Dharma, They display a performance of exactly that, Being well trained in great skillful means.
de dag slob ma mtha' yas shing / / spyod yul rnams kyang mtha' yas te/ / ye shes mtha' yas rdzogs pas na/ / srog chags mtha' yas grol bar byed/ /
Their training is limitless, And their domain is also limitless. They have limitless pristine awareness And set free limitless living beings.
bskal pa bye ba phrag brgyar ni/ / bcom ldan sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang / / de yi yon tan mtha' brjod dka'/ / zhes bya ba'o// //
Not in tens of millions of aeons,[xxvii] Nor even in billions of aeons, Even if the Buddhas were speaking, Would it be easy to express the limit of their abilities.[xxviii]
bam po bcu bzhi pa ste tha ma/

byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan rnams ni/ dkon mchog ta la la'i gzungs las ji skad gsungs pa de ltar bsgom par bya ste/ me tog phal cher me tog bla re dang / / me tog bkod pa'i 'od zer rab bkye ste/ / me tog sna tshogs kun du bkram byas shing / / bdag nyid chen po de dag rgyal ba mchod/ /

You should meditate on the abilities of bodhisattvas as they are described in the Precious Lamp Dhāraṇī: Emitting the radiance of flower arrays, Flower garlands, and flower canopies, Scattering flowers of many colors everywhere, Those great ones make offerings to the Victors.

bdug pa phal cher bdug pa'i bla re dang / / bdug pa bkod pa'i 'od zer rab bkye ste/ / bdug pa sna tshogs kun du bkram byas shing / / bdag nyid chen po de dag rgyal ba mchod/ / phal cher spos dang spos kyi bla re dang / / spos kyi bkod pa'i 'od zer rab bkye ste/ / sna tshogs spos rnams kun du bkram byas shing / / bdag nyid chen po de dag rgyal ba mchod/ / phreng ba phal cher phreng ba'i bla re dang / / phreng ba bkod pa'i 'od zer rab bkye ste/ / phreng ba sna tshogs kun du bkram byas shing / / bdag nyid chen po de dag rgyal ba mchod/ /
phye ma phal cher phye ma'i bla re dang / / phye ma bkod pa'i 'od zer rab bkye ste/ / phye ma sna tshogs kun du bkram byas shing / / bdag nyid chen po de dag rgyal ba mchod/ /
Emitting the radiance of powder arrays, Powder garlands, and powder canopies, Scattering powders of many colors everywhere, Those great ones make offerings to the Victors. [xxix]

na bza' phal cher na bza'i bla re dang / / na bza' bkod pa'i 'od zer rab bkye ste/ / na bza' sna tshogs kun du bkram byas shing / / bdag nyid chen po de dag rgyal ba mchod/ / phal cher gdugs dang gdugs kyi bla re dang / / gdugs kyi bkod pa'i 'od zer rab bkye ste/ / sna tshogs gdugs rnams kun du bkram byas shing / / bdag nyid chen po de dag rgyal ba mchod/ / rin chen phal cher rin chen bla re dang / / rin chen bkod pa'i 'od zer rab bkye ste/ / rin chen sna tshogs kun du bkram byas shing / / bdag nyid chen po de dag rgyal ba mchod/ /
pad ma phal cher pad+ma'i bla re dang / / pad ma bkod pa'i 'od zer rab bkye ste/ / pad ma sna tshogs kun du bkram byas shing / / bdag nyid chen po de dag rgyal ba mchod/ /
Emitting the radiance of lotus arrays, Lotus garlands, and lotus canopies, Scattering lotuses of many colors everywhere, Those great ones make offerings to the Victors.
rgyan phreng phal cher rgyan phreng bla re dang / / rgyan phreng bkod pa'i 'od zer rab bkye ste/ / rgyan phreng sna tshogs kun du bkram byas shing / / bdag nyid chen po de dag rgyal ba mchod/ /
Emitting the radiance of pearl arrays, Pearl garlands, and pearl canopies, Scattering pearls of many colors everywhere, Those great ones make offerings to the Victors.
rgyal mtshan mchog bkod 'od zer rab bkye zhing / / de dag rgyal mtshan dkar dmar ser po dang / / sngo dang rgyal mtshan bkod pa sna tshogs pa/ / du mas rgyal ba'i zhing rnams brgyan par byed/ /
Emitting the radiance of arrays of the best flags, With white, red, and yellow flags, With many blue ones, and banners of many colors,[xxx] They decorate with flags the fields of the Victors.

nor bu'i dra ba sna tshogs bkod pa'i gdugs/ / dar gyi lda ldi ba dan rab dpyangs shing / / dril g.yer dra ba rgyal ba'i gsung sgrogs pa/ / de bzhin gshegs kyi dbu la de dag 'dzin/ / lag pa'i mthil nas mchod pa bsam byas rnams/ / rgyal ba gcig la mchod pa byed pa ltar/ / rgyal ba ma lus kun la'ang de bzhin te/ / drang srong ting 'dzin rnam 'phrul 'di 'dra'o/ /

As each of them holds a parasol at the head of a Tathāgata With garlands of cloth flags hanging down And nets of bells making sounds like the voices of the Victors And makes an inconceivable offering from the palm of the hand to a single Victor, They make offerings similarly to all the Victors without exception. Through this miracle of meditative absorption of the seers,
de dag 'gro ba sdud pa'i ye shes kyis/ / rnam par 'phrul dang ting 'dzin mchog bsgrubs shing / / bya ba dag dang bsnyen bkur kun gyi sgo/ / thabs stong dag gis sems can 'dul bar byed/ /

By the miracle of pristine awareness that brings living beings together, They accomplish the best of meditative absorptions [328] By the door of acts of service of all kinds.[6] They discipline sentient beings with thousands of skillful means:
kha cig de bzhin gshegs pa mchod sgo dang / / sbyin pa bsam gyis mi khyab gtong sgo dang / / sbyangs pa'i yon tan tshul khrims srung sgo dang / / bzod pa mi zad mi 'khrugs sgo dag dang / /
kha cig brtul zhugs dka' thub brtson sgo dang / / bsam gtan rab tu zhi bar gnas sgo dang / / don la rnam nges shes rab sgo rnams dang / / spyod pa kun ldan thabs kyi sgo dag dang / /
tshangs pa'i gnas pa dag dang mngon shes sgo/ / bsdu ba'i dngos pos phan par 'dod sgo dang / / bsod nams bsags dang ye shes sgo dag dang / / bden dang rten dang rnam thar sgo dag dang / /
kha cig stobs dang dbang po lam sgo dang / / nyan thos theg pas rnam par grol sgo dang / / rkyen gyi theg pas rnam par dag sgo dang / / theg pa mchog gi rnam par 'phrul sgo dang / /
kha cig mi rtag nyid dang sdug bsngal sgo/ / kha cig bdag med srog med sgo dag dang / / mi sdug 'du shes 'dod chags bral sgo dang / / zhi 'gog ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo yis 'dul/ /
'gro ba spyod pa'i sgo rnams ji snyed pa/ / de snyed chos kyi sgo la rab zhugs te/ / de dag kun du rnam thar sgo dag nas/ / bsam pa ji bzhin 'jig rten sems can 'dul/ /

As numerous as the ways of life of all living beings— That’s how many Dharma doors they abide in; And they discipline sentient beings in accordance with their intentions. By those doors of universal liberation,
gang dag kun du rnam thar sgo dag nas/ / bsams bzhin 'jig rten sems can 'dul byed pa/ / de dag sus kyang mtshan mar gzung mi nus/ / ting 'dzin rnam par 'phrul pa de 'dra'o/ /

They discipline sentient beings in accordance with their intentions; In the world, no trace of them can be grasped. Some, through their miracles of meditative absorption, Through the highest meditative absorptions in marvelous array,
de dag dga' ba bkod pa ting 'dzin mchog / 'gro ba thams cad yongs smin mthun byed pa/ / dga' bde spro ba rab dga' kun ldan rnams/ / bsams shing bstan zhing sems can 'dul bar byed/ /

And, conformably with helping all living beings to mature, By the door of all forms of delight, rapture, and pleasure, They discipline sentient beings through their intentions and their teachings. Where there is famine, and all those necessities
gang du lo nyes 'jig rten yo byad gang / / bde byed thams cad rab tu dkon gyur pa/ / der ni kun gyi bsams bzhin bya ba yis/ / sbyin pa sbyin zhing 'gro ba'i don rnams byed/ /

That bring happiness in the world are very hard to obtain, There, through all actions that fulfill their intentions, They give gifts and benefit living beings. Giving away the best food and drink with the finest flavors,
de dag zas skom mchog dang ro mchog dang / / gos dang bgo ba rin chen sna tshogs dang / / rgyal srid nor dang bdag phangs yongs gtong bas/ / sbyin la mos pa'i 'gro ba 'dul bar byed/ /

Various clothing, adornments, and jewels, [329] Political power, wealth, and their own dear[xxxii] bodies, They discipline living beings to be committed to generosity. Their bodies are adorned with the best of marks,
brten pa de dag mtshan mchog lus spras shing / / gos dang rgyan mchog bgos shing brgyan byas te/ / phreng bas brgyan cing spos kyis bskus pa yis/ / gzugs rnams bstan pas sems can 'dul bar byed/ /
With the finest ornaments,[xxxiii] Adorned with garlands and anointed with perfumes. Sentient beings, on seeing their bodies, are delighted by pleasure and rapture; Thus they discipline them.
mthong na dga' tshim rab tu dga' rnams la/ / blo mchog de dag mchog tu gzugs bzang ba/ / gzugs kyi dam pa yongs su ston byed cing / / gzugs la mos pa'i sems can 'dul bar byed/ /
They are highly intelligent and handsome, with the best appearance, Displaying an unsurpassed appearance; They discipline living beings to be committed to form[8] With honeyed sparrow-songs.
de dag ka la ping ka'i sgra snyan dang / / khu byug kun la ngang pa'i sgra skad dang / / rnga dang tshangs dang mi'am ci yi sgras/ / mos pa kun la de bzhin chos kyang ston/ /
With the songs of the cuckoo and the wild goose,[xxxiv] With the kettle-drum, and the voices of half-humans and Brahmā gods, They teach the Dharma, as regards all forms of religious commitment.
stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi gang yin pas/ / rgyal ba gang dag 'gro ba'i don mdzad pa'i/ / chos kyi bye brag sgo mo de dag gis/ / bsam pa ji bzhin 'jig rten sems can 'dul/ /

Employing the eighty-four thousand teachings With which the Victors benefit the world, Through an unlimited number of different Dharma doors, They discipline sentient beings in the world, in accordance with their intention.
de dag bde dang sdug bsngal grogs kyang byed/ / don dang gnod pa'i grogs kyang de bzhin byed/ / bya ba kun la grogs su 'gyur byas shing / / grogs kyi sgo nas sems can 'dul bar byed/ /
They act as friends in times of happiness and suffering; They are friends in good times and bad, And, having become friends in all activities, They discipline sentient beings through friendship.
sdug bsngal gnod pa 'dus byas skyon rnams la/ / grogs kyi don du de dag bzod byed cing / / 'gro ba kun la phan don bde don du/ / de dag grogs don gnod pa dang du len/ /
They are able to bear the problems caused by[xxxv] pain and disaster For the sake of friendship; As friends, they can bear torments For the welfare and happiness of the whole world.

gang na sngon byung med cing chos med de/ / dgon par 'gro dang thar pa mi dmigs pa/ / der ni rgyal srid 'byor pa rab spangs te/ / zhi ba'i yid kyis gnas med mngon par 'byung / / de dag khyim dang 'ching dang bsreg pa'i gnas/ / 'gro ba thams cad yongs su dgrol ba'i rgyur/ /

Where ordination and Dharma are unknown, And going to the wilderness[xxxvi] and freedom are not thought of, There they go forth from political power and prosperity[xxxvii] [330] Homeless, with peaceful minds, So as to set the whole world free From the house of craving, the fetters of the home life.

'dod pa'i dga' ba kun la mi gnas par/ / mngon par byung zhing thar pa rab tu brjod/ / de dag spyod pa bcu rnams rjod byed cing / / skyes chen rnams kyi chos spyod gang yin dang / / drang srong rnams kyi spyod yul ma lus par/ / yongs su brjod cing 'gro ba'i don rnams byed/ /

Having no home in any of the delights of the senses, They promulgate ordination and freedom. Proclaiming the ten courses of action And the Dharma and way of life of great people, Cultivating the way of life of the seers in its entirety, with no exceptions, They benefit living beings.
gang na sems can dpag med tshe ldan zhing / / bde dang ldan la nyon mongs chung yod pa/ / der ni rga bas nyen cing nad bu can/ / bdag la dbang med 'chi ba'i dbang gyur ston/ /

Where sentient beings have unlimited lifespans And are happy, with weak reactive emotions, There, if asked, those who are under no one else’s power Show themselves tormented by old age and disease, under the power of death.
'dod chags 'bar zhing zhe sdang rab 'bar la/ / 'jig rten gti mug me chen rab 'bar zhing / / rga dang na dang 'chi ba rab 'bar ba'i/ / 'jig rten bstan gnas sems can 'dul bar byed/ /

To a world that is burning with attraction, burning with aversion, Burning with the great fire of delusion, Showing themselves blazing, subject to old age, disease, and death, They discipline sentient beings.
de dag sangs rgyas stobs bcu brtson bzhi dang / / chos kyi khyad par bco brgyad rnams kyis kyang / / sangs rgyas che ba'i bdag nyid rjod byed cing / / sangs rgyas yon tan rnams kyis 'gro don byed/ /
Pointing out the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses,[xxxviii] Also the eighteen unique qualities, And the greatness of the Buddhas, With the abilities of Buddhas, they benefit sentient beings.
de dag kun brjod rdzu 'phrul rjes bstan pas/ / gzugs kyi byin rlabs stobs kyis thams cad du/ / de bzhin gshegs pa'i rdzu 'phrul ston byed cing / / rdzu 'phrul rnam par 'phrul pas sems can 'dul/ /

Those teachers who speak through miracles, Everywhere, through the power of giving the energy of form,[xxxix] Showing the miracle powers of the Tathāgatas, By performing miracles, they discipline sentient beings.
de dag thabs tshul rnam pa sna tshogs kyis/ / 'jig rten rgyu zhing 'gro ba'i don rnams byed/ / 'jig rten mi chags chu la pad ma bzhin/ / dga' zhing dad par byed la rnam par rgyu/ /

Using various methods of skillful means, Wandering through the world, they benefit living beings. Unsullied by the world, like the lotus flower in water, They wander, bringing delight and earning people’s trust.
de dag snyan dngags mkhan rgyal snyan dngags sbyor/ / gar mkhan rnga mkhan gyad dang rol mo mkhan/ / bzhugs mdzes rgyan phreng thogs shing gar byed dang / / sgyu ma mkhan po gzugs mang kun du ston/ /
They become poets and leading authors, Dancers, actors, boxers, athletes,[xl] Parasol-holders, shadow-puppeteers, porters, and dancers: [331] They are illusionists, manifesting abundant forms.
grong pa grong dpon kha lo sgyur bar 'gyur/ / de bzhin ded dpon tshong dpon khyim bdag 'gyur/ / rgyal po blon po mdun 'don pho nya dang / / sman pa 'jigs med bstan bcos cho ga mkhan/ /

They become village headmen, lords, and charioteers; They become wealthy traders, guild presidents, and leading merchants, Royal ministers, family chaplains, messengers, And skilled physicians, learned in treatises and rituals.
de dag dgon par ljon shing chen por 'gyur/ / sman dang rin chen mi zad gter rnams dang / / yid bzhin nor bu 'dod sbyin sdong po dang / / lam gol dong ba rnams la lam ston 'gyur/ /

In the forests, they become great trees, Medicinal plants, and inexhaustible storehouses of precious gems, Wish-fulfilling gems, wish-granting trees, And guides for those who have gone down the wrong path.
'jig rten byung nas mi ring shes gyur cig / sems can lam gyi tshul rnams mi shes pa/ / de dag kun la rmongs chos tshong thabs dang / / sna tshogs bzo rnams 'jig rten rjod par byed/ /

Not long after they are born into the world, they become knowledgeable;[xli] For sentient beings who are ignorant of practical skills, They teach agricultural work, business methods, trading, And various technical skills to the world.
'tshe med gnod sems med pa'i sbyor ba gang / / sems can bde byed mkhas pas rab bsngags pa/ / rig stobs sman dang bstan bcos sna tshogs kun/ / drang srong de dag rnams kyis rab tu brjod/ /

They do no harm and put nonviolence into practice. Bringing all forms of happiness, they are praised by the intelligent. Various forms of power and awareness, medicinal plants, and treatises: Those seers teach about them all.
gang la lhar bcas 'jig rten rmongs 'gyur ba/ / drang srong spyod mchog dam pa gang yin dang / / brtul zhugs dka' spyad dka' thub spyod kun kyang / / mkhas pas de dag rnams kyis rab tu brjod/ /

Those seers, whose practice is holy and supreme, The world with its gods has confidence in them; The vows that are difficult to fulfill, the best kinds of austerities: Those wise ones teach about them all.
de dag spyod can kun rgyu mu stegs can/ / gdung ba gau ta ma dang mi smrar spyod/ / gcer bu gos med lhur len dge sbyong la/ / mu stegs can gyi slob dpon mkhas par ston/ /

For among wandering mendicants and itinerant ascetics who bathe at fords, Gotama ascetics, ascetics who take vows of silence, naked ascetics, And religious wanderers whose spiritual teachers are naked, [332] They become non-Buddhist teachers.
de dag kun du 'tsho ba'i chos 'dzin dang / / bla na yod dang bla na med rnams dang / / ral pa ring dang gzhon nu'i brtul zhugs can/ / de dag tu yang slob dpon 'gyur ba yin/ /
Among those who practice the Ajīvika teachings, Both higher and lower,[xlii] And among those with long dreadlocks, and those who vow celibacy, They also become teachers.
nyi ma'i rjes lta dka' thub lnga ldan dang / / khyi dang ba lang brtul zhugs ri dwags spyod/ / gle'u can dang mu stegs sum cu pa/ / de dag tu yang de dag slob dpon 'gyur/ /

Among those who follow the sun, and the five-fire ascetics, Among dog-duty and cow-duty ascetics,[9] and those who act like wild animals, Among the thirty types of non-Buddhist wanderers, They also become teachers.
lhag pa'i shes la 'jug par dga' rnams dang / / mu stegs nye reg yul du rgyu rnams su/ / rtsa ba 'bras bu chu spyod gyur nas kyang / / bsam yas chos la de dag dam pa mchog /
Delighting in entering into divine knowledge, Traveling among various fords and places of ritual bathing, Living on roots, fruits, and water, They [practice] the supreme, inconceivable holy Dharma.
tsog pur 'dug dang gcig pur rgyu ba dang / / tsher ma rtswa dang thal bar nyal ba dang / / gang dag gtun shing mal can gnas pa dang / / de dag tu yang de dag slob dpon 'gyur/ /
Among those who remain in a sitting position or move only in one way, And those who sleep on thorns, ashes, or grass, And those who sleep on a wooden pestle, They become teachers.
phyi rol mu stegs can rnams ji snyed pa/ / de dag bsam pa mos pa rtogs byas shing / / bsnyen dka' mi bzad drag shul dka' thub kyis/ / mu stegs can gyi sdug bsngal spang bar 'dul/ /

However many different kinds of non-Buddhist outsiders there are, [The bodhisattvas] carefully examine their intentions and religious commitments, And through sharp, fierce austerities that are difficult to bear, [333] Discipline them so that they leave suffering behind.
'jig rten lta bas 'khrug pa shes byas nas/ / lta ba ngan la gnas pa'i mu stegs can/ / kun la phra ba'i gzhi dang thabs tshul gyis/ / de dag rnams la bden pa ston par byed/ /

Seeing that the world is bewildered by false views, Seeing all the non-Buddhists who rely on wrong views, Through methods of skillful means whose traces are subtle, [The bodhisattvas] make the truth obvious to them.
la lar 'gro lding ba yi sngags kyi gzhi/ / shin tu gsang ba'i gzhi yis bden pa ston/ / la la dag la gsal zhing drang tshig gis/ / la la dag la lha yi gsang tshig gis/ /
la la dag la yi ge dbye tshig dang / / don la rnam nges rdo rje'i tshig rnams dang / / rgol ba 'dul bar shes pa'i tshig rnams dang / / bstan bcos thub med thar pa'i tshig rnams kyis/ /
la la dag la mi skad tshig rnams dang / / kun la 'jug pa nges tshig rnams kyis su/ / la la dag la lha yi nges tshig dang / / klu yi nges tshig gnod sbyin nges tshig gis/ /
la lar srin po 'byung po sha za dang / / dri za grul bum lto 'phye che tshig dang / / mi ci lha min mkha' lding tshig rnams kyis/ / bden pa bstan cing thar par 'dren par byed/ /

With words belonging to ogres, fire priests,[xliii] celestial musicians, Goblins,[xliv] trolls and great snakes; With the words of half-humans, nymphs,[xlv] and garuḍas, They teach the truth and lead people to freedom.
de dag bden dang nges tshig tshul shes te/ / de ltar rgyal ba'i chos rnams ma lus pa'i/ / chos nyid bsam byas tshig lam shes par ston/ / de dag ting 'dzin rnam 'phrul de 'dra'o/ /

Knowing the methods of accurate etymology And the paths of speech, they teach the inconceivable Dharma, All the teachings of the Victor, without exception.[xlvi] Such is their miracle of meditative absorption.
de dag 'gro bde mchog gi ting nge 'dzin/ / 'gro ba kun la mngon par sgrub byed cing / / 'od zer bsam gyis mi khyab rab bkye ste/ / 'od zer bkye nas sems can 'dul bar byed/ /

For the happiness of living beings, [the bodhisattvas] produce in all living beings The highest forms of meditative absorption, And emit inconceivable rays; By giving off rays, they discipline sentient beings.
mthong na legs pa'i 'od zer rab gtong zhing / / sems can ji snyed 'od zer de shes pa/ / de dag mthong legs don med ma yin te/ / bla na med pa'i ye shes mchog gi rgyu/ /

[The bodhisattvas] give off a ray called Wonderful Sight.[xlvii] In those sentient beings who become aware of this ray Arises the beautiful and unfailing cause Of the highest and supreme pristine awareness.
mi rnams kun la sangs rgyas yongs bstan dang / / chos kyang yongs su bstan de lam bstan cing / / rgyal ba'i sku gzugs mchod rten bstan byas pas/ / des na mthong legs 'od zer grub par 'gyur/ /

By teaching human beings about the Buddhas, and also teaching About the Dharma and the religious community and demonstrating the path, And by showing people stūpas and images of the Victors: [334] In this way, the ray called Wonderful Sight is attained.[xlviii]
lha yi 'od zer zil gyis gnon pa yi/ / 'od zer 'od byed ces bya rab gtong zhing / / rdul dang mun pa thams cad bsal byas te/ / 'jig rten phan pa'i 'od de rab tu snang / /
They give off a ray called Lightbringer Which outshines the radiance of the gods. Those who have removed all dust and darkness Radiate that light for the welfare of the world.
sems can gang dag 'od des bskul byas pa/ / de dag rgyal ba mchod phyir sgron ma 'dzin/ / de dag rgyal ba mchod phyir sgron bzung bas/ / 'jig rten sgron ma mdzad pa'i rgyal bar gyur/ /
Those sentient beings who are impelled by that radiance Carry lamps to offer to the Victors, And after carrying lamps as offerings to the Victors, They become Victors who illuminate the world.
'bru mar mar me mar gyi mar me dang / / rtswa shing 'dam bu 'od ma'i sgron ma dang / / spos dang bcud len rin chen sgron ma dag / rgyal ba rnams la phul nas 'od byed thob/ /
By offering oil-lamps and butter-lamps Made of wood, grass, reeds, or bamboo, Lamps with perfumes, alchemical elixirs, and jewels To the Victors, Lightbringer is attained.
sgrol zhes bya ba'i 'od zer rab gtong zhing / / sems can gang dag 'od des bskul byas la/ / de dag sred spangs sred pa'i rgya mtsho las/ / sems can sgrol ba'i don du go cha gyon/ /

They emit a ray called Liberator; Those sentient beings who are impelled by that radiance {Leave craving behind, and in order to save sentient beings From the ocean of existence, they put on the armor.
gang dag sred spangs sred pa'i rgya mtsho las/ / sems can sgrol ba'i don du go gyon pa/ / de dag chu bo bzhi las rab tu sgrol/ / mya ngan med pa'i bde ba'i grong khyer ston/ /

Those who leave craving behind, and in order to save sentient beings From the ocean of existence, put on the armor— They liberate beings from the four bodies of water And show them the sorrowless city of happiness,
stegs dang zam pa du ma byas pa dang / / chu klung lam la sgrol ba'i gru byin te/ / 'dus byas sun phyung zhi ba bsngags byas pas/ / des na sgrol ba'i 'od zer grub par 'gyur/ /
The bridge to the uncompounded,}[xlix] And on the flowing river, give them the ship of salvation. By critiquing the compounded and praising peace, In this way, the ray called Liberator is attained.
skom pa sel ba'i 'od zer rab gtong zhing / / sems can gang dag 'od des bskul byas pa/ / 'dod pa'i yon tan skom pa rab spangs shing / / chos la mos pa'i ro ni don du gnyer/ /
There is a ray named Dispelling Craving.[10] Sentient beings who are impelled by that radiance Give up craving for the pleasures of the senses And seek the taste of Dharma and freedom.[l]
'dod pa'i yon tan skom pa rab spangs te/ / chos mos ro la don du gnyer gyur pas/ / bdud rtsi char pa 'bebs pa'i sangs rgyas 'gyur/ / 'jig rten skom pa'i sred pa rnam par sel/ /

After giving up craving for the pleasures of the senses And seeking the taste of Dharma and freedom, They become Buddhas, raining down the water of the deathless And dispelling craving and thirst in the world.
rdzing dang khron pa chu klung chu rdo dang / / mtsho rnams byang chub don du byed btsud de/ / 'dod pa smad cing bsam gtan bsngags byas pas/ / des na skom pa sel ba grub par 'gyur/ /

By constructing, for the sake of Awakening, Lotus-ponds, canals,[li] wells, deep pools, and springs, By criticizing sensual pleasures and praising meditative stability: In this way, Dispelling Craving is attained.
dga' bar byed pa'i 'od zer rab gtong zhing / / sems can gang dag 'od des bskul byas pa/ / dga' bas rgyas shing byang chub mchog don du/ / rab 'byung 'gyur bar bya zhes sems bskyed do/ /

They emit a ray called Blissful. Sentient beings who are impelled by that radiance Are filled with bliss, and for the sake of the highest Awakening, [335] Spontaneously develop the intention {to seek ordination.}[lii]
thugs rje ldan pa'i sku gzugs mtshan brgyan pa/ / pad+ma'i gdan la bzhugs pa rnams byas shing / / rtag tu sangs rgyas yon tan rnams brjod pa/ / des na dga' byed 'od zer grub par 'gyur/ /
By making images of the Compassionate Ones, adorned with the marks And seated on lotus thrones, And by always proclaiming the abilities of the Buddhas: In this way, the Blissful ray is perfected.
mgu bar byed pa'i 'od zer rab gtong zhing / / sems can gang dag 'od des bskul byas pa/ / rtag tu sangs rgyas la ni dga' mgu zhing / / chos la dga' mgu dge 'dun dga' mgu'o/ /
They emit a ray called Delightful. Sentient beings who are awakened by that radiance Are always delighted with the Buddhas, Delighted with the Dharma, and delighted with the religious community.
de dag rtag tu sangs rgyas dga' mgu zhing / / chos la dga' mgu dge 'dun dga' mgu nas/ / sangs rgyas chos dang 'phags pa'i tshogs rnams dang / / rtag tu 'grogs thob bzod pa bla med 'thob/ /
Once they have become delighted with all three,[liii] The collection of all Buddhas, the Dharma, and the assembly of noble ones, They attain the acceptance that nothing arises.
sangs rgyas rjes dran chos dang tshogs mchog la/ / sems can mang po bskul zhing dran byas te/ / byang chub sems kyi yon tan rab brjod pas/ / des na mgu byed 'od zer grub par 'gyur/ /

By inciting many sentient beings to recollect The Buddha, the Dharma, and the assembly of noble ones, Helping them to be mindful, and praising the advantages of the Awakening Mind: In this way, the Delightful ray is perfected.
bsod nams bsags pa'i 'od zer rab gtong zhing / / sems can gang dag 'od des bskul byas pa/ / bla na med pa'i byang chub don gnyer zhing / / sbyin pa sna tshogs du ma sbyin par byed/ /
They emit a ray called Gathering Goodness. Sentient beings who are impelled by that radiance Give many and various gifts, With the highest Awakening as their goal.
gtan pa med pa'i mchod pa de byed tshe/ / slong ba rnams kyi bsam pa rdzogs byed de/ / bsam pa thams cad sbyin pa byin byas pas/ / bsod nams bsags pa'i 'od zer grub par gyur/ /
By making unrestricted sacrifices, Fulfilling all the wishes of beggars, And universally giving people just what they want, The Gathering Goodness ray is perfected.
ye shes ldan pa'i 'od zer rab gtong zhing / / sems can gang dag 'od des bskul byas pa/ / chos gcig sgo mo nas ni du ma yi/ / chos kyi sgo rnams yud kyis khong du chud/ /
They emit a ray called Bearer of Knowledge. Sentient beings who are impelled by that radiance Starting from one Dharma door, [336] Instantly master many Dharma doors.
chos kyi dbye ba sems can 'dzin btsud de/ / don la nges pa'i ye shes rnams phye zhing / / chos kyi tshig don brjod pa byas pas na/ / des na ye shes ldan pa'i 'od zer 'grub/ /

By helping sentient beings to grasp Dharma distinctions, By developing knowledge of how to analyze meanings, And by explaining the meanings of Dharma terms: In this way, the Bearer of Knowledge radiance is perfected.
shes rab sgron ma'i 'od zer rab gtong zhing / / sems can gang dag 'od des bskul byas pa/ / stong pa bdag med ma skyes ma byung zhing / / rang bzhin med pa'i chos la rab tu 'jug /

They emit[liv] a ray called Lamp of Wisdom. Sentient beings who are impelled by that radiance Engage with everything they experience as empty, without any being, Not arisen, having the nature of a nonentity.
bdag po med chos stong pa byed med pa/ / sgyu ma smig rgyu chu zla mtshungs 'dra zhing / / rmi lam mtshungs la gzugs brnyan 'dra ba dag / ston pas shes rab sgron ma de grub po/ /
By teaching that everything is ownerless, empty, without activity, Like illusions or mirages, Like dreams, reflections, or the moon in water, The Lamp of Wisdom is perfected.
chos kyi rnam 'phrul 'od zer rab gtong zhing / / sems can gang dag 'od des bskul byas pa/ / mi zad mdzod kyi gzungs ni thob gyur nas/ / de bzhin gshegs pa kun gyi mdzod kyang 'dzin/ /
They emit a ray called Miracle of Dharma. Sentient beings who are impelled by that radiance Gain a limitless treasury of mnemonic powers And then attain the treasury of all the Tathāgatas.
chos 'dzin rnams la yongs su phan btags te/ / drang srong rnams la chos kyis bsrung byas shing / / 'gro ba chos kyi rjes su gzung byas pas/ / chos kyi rnam 'phrul 'od zer grub par 'gyur/ /
By assisting those learned in the Dharma And providing protection according to Dharma to the seers, By causing living beings to cherish the Dharma, The Miracle of Dharma ray is perfected.
gtong dang ldan pa'i 'od zer rab gtong zhing / / sems can 'jungs pa gang dag des bskul ba/ / longs spyod mi rtag mi brtan shes gyur nas/ / de dag rtag tu gtong la dga' mos 'gyur/ /
When they emit the ray called Renunciant, Greedy sentient beings who are impelled by it Come to know that possessions are impermanent, not eternal, And thus always come to delight in renunciation.
ma dul gdul dka'i sems can ser sna can/ / nor rnams rmi lam sprin dang 'drar shes nas/ / dga' ba'i yid kyis sbyin pa spel byas pas/ / des na gtong dang ldan pa'i 'od grub po/ /

By leading untamed, difficult to tame, greedy sentient beings To the knowledge that wealth has the nature of a cloud in a dream, So that they confidently develop renunciation: In this way, the Renunciant radiance is perfected.
yongs su gdung med 'od zer rab gtong zhing / / khrims 'chal sems can gang dag des bskul ba/ / tshul khrims rnam par dag la gnas gyur nas/ / rang 'byung 'gyur bar bya zhes sems bskyed do/ /
They emit a ray called Not on Fire. Immoral sentient beings who are impelled by it Become established in pure moral discipline [337] And spontaneously develop the intention [to Awaken.][lv]
dge ba'i las lam yongs su dag pa dang / / tshul khrims la yang sems can mang 'dzud cing / / byang chub sems kyang yang dag 'dzin bcug pas/ / yongs gdung med pa'i 'od zer de grub po/ /
By leading many sentient beings to adopt the wholesome courses of action And pure moral discipline, And by instilling Awakening Mind in them, This ray, Not on Fire, is perfected.
bzod pa bkod pa'i 'od zer rab gtong zhing / / mi bzod sems can gang dag des bskul ba/ / khro dang tha ba nga rgyal yongs spongs shing / / de ni rtag tu bzod mos dga' bar 'gyur/ /

They emit a ray called Marvelous Display of Patient Endurance. Impatient sentient beings who are impelled by it Give up anger, harshness, and arrogance, and then Always take delight in patient endurance.
sdig ldan rnams kyis nyes byas bzod byas te/ / byang chub don du 'khrug pa ma byas shing / / bzod pa'i yon tan rtag tu bsngags brjod pas/ / des na bzod pa bkod pa de grub po/ /

By being patient towards wrongdoers who have the mind-set of the lower realms, By having a mind that, for the sake of Awakening, does not get angry, And by always praising the advantages of patient endurance: In this way the Marvelous Display of Patient Endurance is perfected.
brtun dang ldan pa'i 'od zer rab gtong zhing / / le lo'i sems can gang dag des bskul ba/ / rigs par brtson pa dkon mchog gsum rnams la/ / sbyor ba skyo med mchod pa byed par 'gyur/ /
When they give off the ray Blazing with Energy, Lazy sentient beings who are impelled by it Make an effort at what is rational, and tirelessly Make offerings to the Three Jewels.
rigs par brtson pa dkon mchog gsum rnams la/ / sbyor ba skyo ba med pas mchod byas nas/ / de dag bdud bzhi'i lam las rab 'das te/ / byang chub bla med myur du reg par 'gyur/ /
After they make an effort at what is rational, and tirelessly Make offerings to the Three Jewels, Going beyond the paths of the four Māras, They soon touch highest Awakening.
sems can mang po brtson 'grus 'dzin bcug ste/ / dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa rab byas nas/ / zad pa'i dus na dam chos yongs bzung bas/ / des na brtun par ldan pa'i 'od thob po/ /

By getting many sentient beings to develop perseverance, By making offerings to the Three Jewels, And by upholding the Dharma at the time of death: In this way, the radiance Blazing with Energy is attained.
zhi bar byed pa'i 'od zer rab gtong zhing / / rnam 'khrug sems can ji snyed des bskul ba/ / de dag chags dang sdang dang rmongs med cing / / rtogs par gyur nas mnyam gzhag sems su 'gyur/ /
When they emit the ray Peacebringer, Agitated sentient beings who are impelled by it Have no attraction, aversion, or delusion, and Come to know directly, with their minds absorbed in meditation.
sdig pa'i grogs po skyon ldan spyod can dang / / 'dre ba yongs su rnam par spangs byas te/ / dgon par rab zhi bsam gtan rab brjod pas/ / des na zhi bar byed pa'i 'od grub po/ /

By getting people to turn away from social interactions With bad friends, wrongdoers who live in a reactive way, By praising peaceful meditation in the wilderness: In this way, the radiance Peacebringer is attained.
shes rab bkod pa'i 'od zer rab gtong zhing / / shes 'chal sems can ji snyed des bskul ba/ / bden dang rten dang rnam thar tshul rnams dang / / dbang po shes pa rtogs par khong chud cing / /

They emit the ray Marvelous Display of Wisdom. Unwise sentient beings who are impelled by it Master this way of freedom, truth, and dependent arising, and [338] Go to the destination of pristine awareness.
Once they have mastered [this way of freedom, truth, and dependent arising and] Gone to the destination of pristine awareness,[lvi]
nyi ma'i sgron ma'i ting 'dzin thob gyur nas/ / shes rab snang bar mdzad pa'i rgyal bar 'gyur/ /
They attain the meditative absorption called Lamp of the Sun, And become Victors, radiant with wisdom.
rgyal srid nor dang bdag phangs yongs btang ste/ / byang chub don du chos gang btsal byas pa/ / chos de gus par byas nas rab bshad pas/ / shes rab bkod pa'i 'od zer de grub po/ /

By honoring the one who gave up royal sovereignty, wealth, and his dear body And who sought out the Dharma for the sake of Awakening, And by proclaiming the Dharma, The ray Marvelous Display of Wisdom is perfected.
sangs rgyas ldan pa'i 'od zer rab gtong zhing / / sems can gang dag 'od des bskul byas pa/ / sangs rgyas stong phrag du ma bsam yas rnams/ / pad+ma dam pa rnams la bzhugs par mthong / /
They emit the ray Abounding in Buddhas. Sentient beings who are impelled by that radiance See inconceivably many thousands of Buddhas Seated on a forest of lotuses.

sangs rgyas che dang sangs rgyas rnam thar dang / / sangs rgyas rnam 'phrul mtha' yas brjod byas shing / / sangs rgyas stobs dang rdzu 'phrul rab brjod pas/ / des na sangs rgyas ldan pa'i 'od grub po/ /

By proclaiming the greatness of the Buddhas, the freedom of the Buddhas, The endless miracles of the Buddhas, By ensuring that the powers of the Buddhas do not lack for glory,[lvii] The radiance Abounding in Buddhas is perfected.
mi 'jigs sbyin pa'i 'od zer rab gtong zhing / / 'jigs nyen sems can gang la des reg pa/ / 'byung po gza' dang gsad brdeg bcing ba dang / / nad 'go 'jigs pa kun las thar bar 'gyur/ /

They emit the ray Granting Safety. Sentient beings in danger who are touched by it Are set free from ghosts, spirits who cause seizures, being harmed, being beaten, From bondage, and from all diseases and dangers.
